text: Lester Keith Piggott (5 November 1935 â€“ 29 May 2022) was an English professional jockey. With 4,493 career wins, including nine Epsom Derby victories, he was seen as one of the greatest flat racing jockeys of all time. He was known as "The Long Fellow". He was known for his competitive personality, keeping himself thirty pounds under his natural weight, and on occasion not sparing the whip on horses such as Nijinsky. Piggott regarded Sir Ivor as the easiest to ride of the great winners.About the Home of Racing Piggott died in hospital in Switzerland on 29 May 2022 at the age of 86. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2022 deaths Category:English jockeys Category:Sportspeople from Berkshire
